text: Polenta () is a dish of boiled cornmeal. It may be served as a hot porridge, or it may be allowed to cool and solidify into a loaf that can be baked, fried, or grilled. It is a dish popular in Italian, Savoy, Swiss, Austrian, Croatian, Slovenian, Serbian, Romanian, Bulgarian, Corsican, Argentine, Brazilian, and Mexican cuisine, and it is a traditional staple food throughout much of northern Italy. == References == Category:Maize Category:Argentine food Category:Austrian food Category:Brazilian food Category:Bulgarian food Category:Croatian food Category:French food Category:Italian food Category:Mexican food Category:Romanian food Category:Serbian food Category:Slovenian food Category:Swiss food Category:Venezuelan food
title: Polenta
